flow.descriptionCdata:
5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.08211d87-d432-4151-b981-030a331a38ca.description=
Executes an Expression (e.x value1 \=\= value2)

Input Parameters\:
value1 - the value to threshold with
value2 - the threshold to threshold against
operator - (\=\=, \!\=,  >, >\=, <, <\=) the type of threshold
okstring - string to push into returnResult if the threshold has not been passed
failedstring - string to push into the returnResult if the threshold has been passed

Responses\:
true - the expression is true
fales - the expression is false
5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.08af5838-4ba5-4fa1-89e1-fcdd61955280.description=
Pings the target computer from a Windows host computer.

Input Parameters\:
host 		- The hostname or IP address of the host computer to ping from.
user 		- Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank). The user to authenticate as.
password 		- Password of the user.
target 		- The target computer to ping.
packets 		- The number of packets to send to the target computer.
packetSize 		- The size of packets to send to the target computer.
command 		- DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE.
characterSet 	- The character encoding of the target computer. The default is UTF-8.
outputPath 		- A network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible it should be changed to use another share that the local system account on the host computer has write-access to. By default, the path must be changed on Windows 2000 computers.

Responses\:
success 		- The target computer responded to all ping requests.
failure 		- The target computer did not respond to any ping request.
diagnosed		- The target computer responded only to some ping requests.
Connection Error	- The host computer could not be found or user credentials supplied to connect to it are incorrect.
Unknown Target	- The target computer could not be resolved to an IP address.

Result\:
The output of the ping operation.

Extra Results\:
returnResult		- The raw output of the Ping operation.
address 		- The actual IP address of the target computer.
% Packet Loss 	- The percentage of packets that ping replies were not received for.
average latency	- The average ping response time in milliseconds.
max latency 		- The maximum response time of all the ping reqeusts (in milliseconds).
min latency 		- The minimum number of milliseconds that was taken to receive a ping response.

Note\: The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.
5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.355cf5f3-1232-4e7f-82a0-582071030342.description=Wait ${waittime} seconds between tries. 5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.5622707a-10f8-46e2-8a16-b9312eb124d1.description=Searches the NT Event Log looking for the windows restarted event. This event (6005) iis written at system startup after the user initiates an expected restart or shutdown by clicking Start and then clicking Shut Down, or by pressing CTRL+ALT+DELETE and then clicking Shut Down. 5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.5dd346c7-ccd0-4784-ae03-a0a3aa2e4722.prompt=Password\: 5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.78c029e3-cf03-45ef-b30b-99472a6e4bfd.prompt=Username\: 5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.cef285ca-af56-44d1-bf70-ca1117b077d5.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.description=
This flow is used to wait and detect whether a server has restarted or not in a number of seconds specified through the input.

Inputs\:
server - The server to wait for.
timeout - The time in seconds to exit if the server has not restarted (set to 10 minutes), tries to get the value from the context.
waittime - The interval between ping checks to see if the server is back up or not (set to 10 seconds).
maxTimeSinceRestart - The maximum number of seconds that is considered when testing whether the server has been restarted. This value will be automatically set to 300 if not specified.
altuser - User to connect to server as.
altpass - Password for altuser.

Responses\:
success - The host appears to have been restarted recently.
failure - The timeout was exceeded before the server restarted or invalid parameters were given as input.
5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.e1011447-4bd1-4676-93b3-9f1693edbfc3.description=Increments a counter which tracks the overall timeout value. 5f7306bd-96bc-4e3a-8e72-c0631b23cb7f.e27277f1-40f7-4d34-b14d-45ddc28c4799.prompt=Host\:
flow.name: Detect Restarted Windows Server

scriptlet.name: Step Error : failure in Flow Detect Restarted Windows Server (64a82345-dd17-4cfb-8a4b-cffa633cb040)
scriptlet.script: scriptletResult = "Host may still be down or invalid parameters were given for searching event log.";

scriptlet.name: Step Resolved : success in Flow Detect Restarted Windows Server (769edd83-0af5-47af-a2d4-aa0282b22c81)
Step Error : failure in Flow Detect Restarted Windows Server (a52666c5-24f0-4eb9-a222-db69e50a5991)
scriptlet.script: scriptletResult = "Error while trying to connect to host. Host name may be invalid.";

scriptlet.name: Step Test Timeout in Flow Detect Restarted Windows Server (6acb4732-a7ce-47ee-b271-0631a7b3f082)
